org.ow2.proactive.authentication.crypto

Class KeyUtil

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.ow2.proactive.authentication.crypto.KeyUtil

  • public class KeyUtil
extends Object
    Symmetric cryptography utilities for Key generation, encryption and decryption

    Refer to the Java Cryptography Extension Reference Guide at to determine which parameters are best for key algorithm, key size and cipher; although "AES", 128 and "AES" should be good enough in most cases.

    Since:
    ProActive Scheduling 1.1

    • Method Detail

      • getSecureRandom

        public static SecureRandom getSecureRandom()

      • generateKey

        public static SecretKey generateKey(String algorithm,
                                    int size)
        Generates a secret symmetric key
        Parameters:
        algorithm - algorithm used for key generation, ie AES
        size - size of the generated key, must be one of 128, 192, 256. Use 128 when unsure, default configurations and providers should refuse to use longer keys.
        Returns:
        the generated key

      • encrypt

        public static byte[] encrypt(SecretKey key,
                             String cipherParams,
                             byte[] message)
                      throws KeyException
        Encrypt a message using a symmetric key
        Parameters:
        key - secret key used for encryption
        cipherParams - cipher parameters: transformations, ie AES
        message - the message to encrypt
        Returns:
        the encrypted message
        Throws:
        KeyException - encryption failed, public key recovery failed

      • decrypt

        public static byte[] decrypt(SecretKey key,
                             String cipherParams,
                             byte[] message)
                      throws KeyException
        Decrypt a message using a symmetric key
        Parameters:
        key - secret key used for decryption
        cipherParams - cipher parameters: transformations, ie AES
        message - the encrypted message
        Returns:
        the decrypted message
        Throws:
        KeyException - private key recovery failed, decryption failed
